categories.title: Rent
categories.comment: Most of the year, we lived in a brother's apartment. He didn't take rent from us, but we bought some furniture instead. In December, we rented a spacious apartment closer to our new home.

categories.title: Mortgage
categories.comment: We're going to close on our new home with cash. So, no mortgage again. Yey!

categories.title: Utilities
categories.comment: We paid for utilities for four months only.

categories.title: Tax
categories.comment: Residence tax for two small properties.

categories.title: Repairs
categories.comment: No repairs for a year.

categories.title: Groceries
categories.comment: Official inflation on groceries in Russia in 2021 was 10,62%. On the other hand, my employer paid for lunches and dinners on the workdays. So, definitely, some lifestyle inflation crept in.

categories.title: Eating out
categories.comment: It's almost twice on eating out. But still a moderate number.

categories.title: Alcohol
categories.comment: Fully sober year for me. And one sider for the missis for a whole year.

categories.title: Gas
categories.comment: We bought used Opel Meriva B with 80,000 miles on it at the end of the year.

categories.title: Maintenance
categories.comment: New tires, oil change and some maintenance for a used car.

categories.title: Car Tax
categories.comment: Tax for our previous car.

categories.title: Insurance
categories.comment: It went to the next year.

categories.title: Parking
categories.comment: We rented apartment with underground parking lot.

categories.title: Public transport
categories.comment: Commute to the center of Moscow. Metro and a bus.

categories.title: Car rent
categories.comment: We were car-free for the whole year. So we used car-sharing.

categories.title: Taxi
categories.comment: And a taxi when we couldn't use car-sharing.

categories.title: Health Insurance
categories.comment: Employer-sponsored super fancy insurance.

categories.title: Doctor visits
categories.comment: We visited doctors a lot this year. And sometimes it wasn't covered by the insurance.

categories.title: Pharmacy
categories.comment: COVID rehabilitation, vitamins, and kid medicine.

categories.title: Entertainment
categories.comment: This year we entertained our kid only. No concerts, no movies for ourselves. Children took most of your free time.

categories.title: Education
categories.comment: Again, this was pre-kindergarten for the kiddo.

categories.title: Sport
categories.comment: Snowboarding in Moscow and some new dumbbells.

categories.title: Hobbies and arts
categories.comment: No time for that too.

categories.title: Clothing
categories.comment: New clothes for the family.

categories.title: Tech & Gadgets
categories.comment: New Yandex Station smart speaker to fill our house with nice music. AirPods Pro and new iPhone 12 for me.

categories.title: Home stuff
categories.comment: Some kitchen and baby stuff.

categories.title: Work supplies
categories.comment: LG Ultrafine 4k monitor. I tried to work from home for the first month. But it was hard to do in one bedroom apartment with the kid. So I sold the monitor and started to commute to work almost every workday.

categories.title: Household goods
categories.comment: More laundry as a kid grows up.

categories.title: Cell phone
categories.comment: Same plan as before.

categories.title: Subscriptions
categories.comment: I canceled my Spotify subscription this year. Instead, I used Yandex Music, which I got for free from my employer. So, this minor expense is the domain for this site.

categories.title: Personal
categories.comment: Expenses on diapers went down, but on beauty products went up.

categories.title: Misc
categories.comment: Expenses for finding a good car, new car seat.

categories.title: Hotels
categories.comment: Snowboarding trip to Sochi and local travel.

categories.title: Travel Transportation
categories.comment: Airplane tickets to Sochi and train tickets.

categories.title: Travel Entertainment
categories.comment: Ski-pass for one week.

categories.title: Food and other
categories.comment: Food for Sochi trip.

categories.title: Presents
categories.comment: Giving away is fun and fulfilling.

categories.title: Parties hosting
categories.comment: Nastya's birthday party. And first real Leo's party with guests, presents and playground.

categories.title: Charity
categories.comment: Gotta improve in this category.

categories.title: Taxes and fees
categories.comment: This is mainly a tax on free food from an employer, which is not entirely free.

categories.title: Fines
categories.comment: One single mistake while driving in the city.

categories.title: Investments
categories.comment: We sold both of our investment properties this year to buy a house. Being a landlord turned out not as fancy as I expected.

categories.title: Paycheck
categories.comment: Our main source of income this year.

categories.title: Side hustle
categories.comment: Somehow I managed to do some side work.

categories.title: Interest
categories.comment: Fancy cashback and interest on the cash account.

categories.title: Stuff sales
categories.comment: This is something we bought this year and sold afterward.

categories.title: Presents
categories.comment: Thanks to friends and family!

categories.title: Other
categories.comment: Restricted share units from my employer.
